summary: This document is a series of internal FBI emails from August 13, 2019, discussing the international fallout following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The emails focus on official requests for information from French authorities (MOJ and French Police) regarding Epstein's activities and property in France, and the coordination of the U.S. government's response. The emails reference a French news article where ministers called for an investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the international information requests; found dead on sex-trafficking charges, with declared residence/property in France.

persons.name: Marlene Schiappa
persons.context: Quoted in a French news article calling for an investigation into Epstein's activities in France.

persons.name: Josh
persons.context: Mentioned as having passed information to the email recipients the previous day.

events.title: French Ministers Call for Investigation
events.description: Two French government ministers, including Marlene Schiappa, publicly call for an investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's activities in France following his death.

events.title: French Authorities Issue Official Requests
events.description: The FBI receives official requests for information from the French Ministry of Justice (MOJ) and the French Police regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in an apparent suicide while being held on sex-trafficking charges, which triggered the international inquiries.

keyFacts: On August 13, 2019, the FBI received official requests for information from the French Ministry of Justice and French Police regarding Jeffrey Epstein.
French Gender Equality Minister Marlene Schiappa publicly called for a French investigation into Epstein's activities, citing ties to France highlighted by the American investigation.
The emails reveal U.S. government (FBI/DOJ) coordination to craft a formal response to the French requests for information.

The U.S. Embassy's Senior Regional Security Officer noted that French investigative activity related to Epstein's declared residence/property in France was documented via US Marshals notifications of international travel by registered sex offenders.
